thread.title: Britons celebrate royal wedding with picnics and street parties

title: Britons celebrate royal wedding with picnics and street parties
text:
May 19, 2018 / 3:21 PM / Updated 5 minutes ago Britons celebrate royal wedding with picnics and street parties Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
WINDSOR, England (Reuters) - Thousands of people across Britain gathered at street parties and picnics in the sunshine to celebrate the royal wedding on Saturday, and festivities were expected to continue into the night as pubs were permitted to stay open longer. People arrive at the train station ahead of the wedding of Britainâ€™s Prince Harry to Meghan Markle, in Windsor, Britain May 19, 2018. REUTERS/Benoit Tessier
Residents hosting parties on their streets put up bunting and served tea and cakes on tables decorated with British flags. Others came together in local parks, pitching tents and marquees decked with balloons and flags.
Large crowds watched live broadcasts of the wedding ceremony on big screens around Britain, including in St Andrews in Scotland, at Winchester Cathedral and in Cambridge. Slideshow (2 Images)
In Greenwich, London, people watching the wedding on a big screen whooped and cheered when the bride and groom kissed, and sang along to the hymns.
Some revellers wore masks depicting the faces of Meghan Markle and members of the British royal family.
Pub opening hours were extended to 1 a.m., instead of the usual 11 p.m. Reporting By Raissa Kasolowsky; Editing by Giles Elgood
